oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Judge John L. Draper, 1980 November, excerpt 05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville judge John L. Draper., conducted on two dates in November 1980 by Malcolm McKinney as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Draper, who served Nashville as a magistrate (1929-1937), General Sessions Judge (1937-1960), and Criminal Court Judge (1960-1982), discusses the food his family ate on their farm in Goodlettsville and how some meats preserved better than others. The complete interview is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Draper, John Lafayette, ca. 1902-1990--Interviews
